Summary Twanna has 10 years experience working for a cross section of government, non-governmental (NGO), nonprofit, and private sector firms. An award­-winning educator powered by innovation and creativity, she has appeared on CNN, NPR, and Sirius as well as CBC (Canadian National Radio) and Paris Première (French Television). She has written for Time Out New York, Lifetime, Mashable, Nerve, New York Press, Fast Company, The Guardian, Huffington Post and Al Jazeera. Quoted by a variety of outlets, including The New York Times, she helps organizations communicate their social impact to generate funds and grow their audiences. 
 
Known as FUNKY BROWN CHICK®, she has been interviewed by news outlets from coast to coast, from the San Francisco Chronicle to The New York Times. 
 
With a background in information and communications technology (ICT), Twanna also provides technical assistance to progressive causes such as poverty reduction, maternal and child health, and the eradication of HIV/AIDS. Namely, she helps private, nonprofit, and government agencies communicate their social impact to generate funds and grow their audiences.

Summary I've spent my career developing creative and strategic ways to communicate complex and controversial issues. From spear-heading projects like Google's Transparency Report to running issues campaigns and conferences, I have experience in driving policy change as well as pitching and managing tough stories. I'm passionate about human rights and how the Internet and institutions that govern it affect those rights. The roles I've enjoyed and thrived in most have required diving deep into many different gray areas, defining a position, building a structure around how to handle them and speedy execution at scale. Experience Professional Tutor AJ Tutoring August 2014  – Present (1 year 1 month) Los Altos, CA I work with students in the Bay Area to help them prepare for the SAT, ACT, and SAT 2 Subject tests. I also work as an academic tutor, supporting students who are looking for extra help with study skills, algebra, and geometry. 
 
As a teacher and a tutor, my goal is to set students up for success: providing the tools they need to reach their potential and the support they need as they make leaps and bounds towards their best and brightest selves. I believe that learning is about recognizing and leveraging our innate capacities, and committing to our growth with zeal and humility. Acknowledging where we have room to grow requires courage, and of course, everyone is different. I am here to help students of all backgrounds develop greater confidence, tried and true strategies, and a set of compassionate tools for engaging with areas for improvement (laughter being chief among them). Summary A ten-year veteran of PR, I am responsible for developing and implementing proactive PR and Public Policy programs for the Google Cultural Institute globally. The Cultural Institute (CI) is Google's premier reputation and engagement project, helping local teams build allies among policy-makers, journalists and high profile cultural institutions. Our partners number 600+ globally, including leading brands such as Tate, MoMA, The Met, The State Hermitage, Uffizi 
 
As the first port of call for the local teams around the world who benefit from this programme, I'm responsible for setting the communications guidelines and providing FAQ, toolkits and more to help them make the most of the opportunity. 
 
Most recently, as part of my role on the management group for the CI, I've helped set the overall strategy for the project, outside of just the PR & Policy remit. Just a few months ago, I worked with the cross functional team to bring Street Art to the CI for the first time, resulting in global media coverage. 
 
Over the last 9 years at Google I've been lucky enough to work on a number of high profile product communications such as Street View and Google Maps, dealing with everything from the most sensitive of crisis communications to the brightest proactive consumer campaigns.

Summary Jeff Barth is the Program Director of MARC (Men Advocating Real Change), a learning community created especially for professional men who are committed to building inclusive workplaces. In this role he is principally responsible for the development, implementation, and marketing of MARC’s strategy and initiatives aimed at empowering individuals to become inclusive leaders and powerful forces for change in the workplace. As an expert on engaging men, Mr. Barth also provides external training, does speaking engagements, and takes part in creating and expanding Catalyst’s engaging men programs. He currently sits on Catalyst’s Diversity and Inclusion Advisory Council and has served on the Catalyst Canada Honours evaluation committee. 
 
Prior to his current role, Mr. Barth was the European Marketing Manager, where he developed strategy for member engagement and worked with the communications and branding teams to leverage Catalyst’s presence across platforms within Europe. Prior to assuming his role as European Marketing Manager, he was an Associate in Catalyst’s Public Affairs department. 
 
Before joining Catalyst, Mr. Barth managed political campaigns for candidates running for federal and local office in Utah. He also taught English in Tianjin, China. Mr. Barth received a joint Bachelor’s degree in Political Science and Sociology from Utah Valley University and is currently studying Mandarin.
